title: Provides that a certain portion of the sidewalk adjacent to the licensed premises of certain second-hand articles dealers is considered to be part of the licensed premises
summary: Provides that a certain portion of the sidewalk adjacent to the licensed premises of dealers of certain second-hand articles is considered to be part of the licensed premises.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3341

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 24, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. MILLMAN -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Cities

       AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the  city  of  New  York,  in
         relation  to providing that a certain portion of the sidewalk adjacent
         to the licensed premises of certain second-hand  articles  dealers  is
         considered to be part of the licensed premises

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision a of section 20-268 of the administrative  code
    2  of  the  city of New York, as amended by local law number 39 of the city
    3  of New York for the year 2006, is amended to read as follows:
    4    a. (1) It shall be unlawful for any dealer in second-hand articles  to
    5  carry  on his or her business at any place other than the one designated
    6  in such license.
    7    (2) FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SUBCHAPTER, A PLACE OF BUSINESS DESIGNATED IN
    8  A LICENSE SHALL INCLUDE THAT PORTION OF THE SIDEWALK  IMMEDIATELY  ADJA-
    9  CENT  TO  THE  LICENSED  PREMISES  FOR  THE  LENGTH OF STOREFRONT OF THE
   10  LICENSED PREMISES AND FOR A WIDTH OF THREE FEET FROM THE  FRONT  OF  THE
   11  LICENSED  PREMISES,  PROVIDED THE SIDEWALK IS A MINIMUM OF SIX FEET WIDE
   12  FROM THE FRONT OF THE LICENSED PREMISES  TO  THE  CURB  OR  STREET.  THE
   13  PROVISIONS  OF THIS PARAGRAPH SHALL NOT APPLY TO DEALERS OF AUTOMOBILES,
   14  MOTOR AND OTHER VEHICLES.
   15    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD08303-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing that a certain portion of the sidewalk adjacent to the licensed premises of certain second-hand articles dealers is considered to be part of the licensed premises
